summary.what: Rewrite coaching: motivated rules, concrete notes triggers, XML tags
summary.why: Generic clarity improvements that happen to align with Opus 4.6 best practices — no model-specific variants needed because good coaching IS Opus-optimized coaching
summary.how: Added motivation to each rule, replaced 11x MUST/CRITICAL with calm framing, concrete 5-point notes trigger checklist, XML section tags, deleted redundant Core Rules block

notes: Council debated generic vs Opus-specific vs pragmatist approaches. All three converged: the problems were clarity problems not model problems. XML tags got initial 'defer' from pragmatist but overruled — the coaching is a Go string constant consumed only by LLMs, no format contract to break. Key insight from Opus prompt guide: explaining WHY a rule exists lets the model generalize correctly, vs imperative shouting which causes overtriggering.
